title: One man dead after party bus crashes into truck in Dubbo
text:
One man dead after party bus crashes into truck in Dubbo.

One man is dead and two others have been injured after a party bus crashed head on into a truck on a road in regional NSW this morning.

The bus, which was covered in erotic pictures advertising Kittens strip club in Brisbane, was travelling along Peak Hill Rd near Dubbo when it collided with a semi-trailer just after 7.30am.

The male driver of the bus died at the scene and one of the passengers was treated for non-life threatening injuries.

The driver of the truck was also treated for minor injuries.

Acting Superintendent Keith Ridley said that the two vehicles “impacted quite heavily”.

“One of the drivers of the vehicles had some serious injuries at the scene. He was worked on by paramedics at the scene but was unable to be revived and unfortunately passed away,” he said.

Police and rescue units were called to the scene and shut down the Newell Highway in both directions.

Acting Superintendent Ridley said described the scene as “harrowing” when emergency services arrived.

“It was a very chaotic scene. Obviously a truck and a bus impacting at the speed limit created quite a bit of carnage,” he said.

“The injury to one of the drivers was quite severe. It was quite a harrowing scene for all emergency first responders.

“It is a tragic set of circumstances.”

Kittens is a popular strip club in Melbourne and it appears another club is opening up in Brisbane this week.

On the club’s website customers can hire a party bus for private functions.

Motorists are being warned to expect lengthy delays.

Pictures from the scene show the entire front of the bus was ripped off during the crash.

Police are investigating the circumstances surrounding the crash.

Acting Superintendent Ridley urged drivers to be careful on the roads and take multiple breaks when driving for long periods of time.

“We are asking people to ensure they have plenty of breaks in relation to managing their fatigue on the road as well as managing their speed,” he said.
description: One man is dead and two others have been injured after a party bus crashed head on into a truck on a road in regional NSW this morning.
